article.name: Partner and Multi-Account: Download Center Guide
article.title: Partner and Multi-Account: Download Center Guide
article.body:
The Download Center contains all PDF and CSV reports for your users or accounts that were downloaded from our Reports feature. This feature also allows you to keep track of all reports that are generated and downloaded in your managed accounts.

See below for information on how to access and use the Download Center.

Accessing the Download Center

The Download Center can be accessed by following the instructions below.

  1. Log in to your KnowBe4 account.
  2. In the KSAT console, click the Reports tab.

In the top-right corner of your console, you’ll see a notification bell. This bell will show timestamps for all generated reports when clicked on and will notify you if a new report has been generated. The reports that appear in this menu can also be downloaded without opening the Download Center at any time.

Note: If you are logged into one of your accounts as an admin, the notification bell will appear in the Account Admin View banner rather than the top-right corner of your console.

While you are logged into a managed account, downloaded reports will go into your management account's Download Center. These downloaded reports will also be seen in the banner bell for Account Admin View.

To download these reports to your computer, you can:

  1. Click the download icon in the modal for the banner bell.OR
  2. Click View Download Center to navigate to your management download center and download the reports from there.

Using the Download Center

Once you have accessed the Download Center, there are several columns with important information. See the image below for details on the information each column contains.

  1. Report: Shows which category the report belonged to and includes an icon that represents whether the report is in CSV or PDF format.
  2. Type: The specific type of report.
  3. Groups: The total number of groups included in the report. If groups were not used in the report, “N/A” will be displayed.
  4. Accounts: The account that generated the report. The person icon indicates the report was generated from a managed account.
  5. Generated on: The date that the report was generated on.
  6. Download: Click this icon to download the report. The green checkmark indicates whether the report was downloaded previously. Hover over the checkmark to see a timestamp of when the report was last downloaded.
  7. Details: When clicking on the report row, additional details for the selected report are displayed. Information such as the date range of the report and specific group names can be found here.
  8. Search bar: If you are looking for reports with specific groups or specific reports, you can search for them by using this field.

All reports found in the Download Center will only be available for 90 days after they were originally created. After 90 days, the reports will be removed from the Download Center.

images.alt:
This image captures the header and primary navigation elements of a web application interface, specifically the KnowBe4 platform.

**Header and Primary Navigation:**

1.  **Branding (Top Left):** The logo identifies the platform as **KnowBe4**, with the tagline, "Human error. Conquered."
2.  **Navigation Links:** A horizontal menu bar features capitalized text links. Visible navigation tabs include: `DASHBOARD`, `ACCOUNTS`, `PHISHING`, `TRAINING`, and `ADMINS`.
3.  **Active Tab:** The navigation tab **REPORTS** is currently active, rendered as a blue rectangular button with white text.

**User and Utility Indicators (Top Right):**

1.  **User Identification:** The logged-in user is identified by the email address `reseller@mgmt.kb4-demo.com`, followed by a downward chevron indicating a profile dropdown menu.
2.  **Utility Icons:** Two utility icons are displayed to the right of the user identification: a blue bell icon (notifications) and a blue circular question mark icon (help/support).

**Content Area:**

1.  **Divider:** A thick orange horizontal line separates the header navigation from the main content area.
2.  **Page Title:** The primary heading of the visible content section is displayed in large, bold black text: **Account Management Reporting**. This indicates the current location within the application.
images.context: ppear in this menu can also be downloaded without opening the Download Center at any time.

images.alt:
This image captures the header and primary navigation bar of the KnowBe4 security awareness platform interface.

**1. Top Header Bar (Blue):**
*   **Context Status:** The left side displays the administrative context: "Account Admin View: reseller@mgmt.kb4-demo.com."
*   **Notifications:** A white bell icon is visible adjacent to the context status. (Note: A large, external red arrow highlights the area around the bell icon.)
*   **Navigation Link (Right):** A right-aligned hyperlink reads: "Click here for Account Management console."

**2. Main Navigation Area:**
*   **Branding:** The KnowBe4 logo and tagline ("Human error. Conquered.") are positioned on the left.
*   **Primary Menu:** A horizontal navigation menu is displayed. The **DASHBOARD** link is highlighted in a solid blue button, indicating the current active page.
*   **Menu Links:** Subsequent menu links include PHISHING, TRAINING, VISHING, USB, AIDA, USERS, ASAP, SECOND CHANCE, MODSTORE, and REPORTS.
*   **User/Help Menu (Right):** The far right displays the current user email, "admin@kb4-demo.com," followed by a dropdown caret. A blue question mark icon (Help link) is located to the right of the user menu.
images.context: in View banner rather than the top-right corner of your console.

images.alt:
This image displays a section of a user interface showing a list of recently generated reports available for download. The layout is a two-column table structure, headed by **Name** and **Generated At**.

**UI Structure and Content:**

1.  **Table Data:** Each row represents a unique report file.
    *   **File Format Indicator:** The left side of each entry features a blue-boxed label indicating the file format (e.g., `PDF`, `CSV`).
    *   **Report Name:** Primary title (e.g., "User Count," "Phish-prone Percentage").
    *   **Category Subtitle:** A secondary line provides context (e.g., "Category: User Count and Login Reports").
    *   **Generation Timestamp:** The right column lists the date and time of creation, using the format DD/MM/YYYY, HH:MM (e.g., 14/07/2021, 14:16).

2.  **Highlighted Entry and Download Action (Annotation 1):**
    *   The bottom visible entry, titled **Phish-prone Percentage** (Category: Phish-prone Percentage Reports, Generated At: 14/07/2021, 14:12), is highlighted with a light gray background, indicating a hover or selection state.
    *   Annotation **(1)** points to a **download icon** (down arrow above a tray) aligned to the right of this highlighted entry, signifying the action to download the PDF file.

3.  **Navigational Element (Annotation 2):**
    *   Below the report list, centered horizontally, is a blue hyperlink: **View Download Center**.
    *   Annotation **(2)** indicates this link, which serves as a navigational call-to-action to access the full report management area.
images.context: ate to your management download center and download the reports from there.

images.alt:
This interface displays a report history log structured into filtering controls, sortable column headers, and data rows.

**UI Controls (Top):**
The top section includes three primary filtering dropdown menus, all currently set to **"All"**:
1.  **Reports:** (Dropdown)
2.  **Accounts:** (Dropdown)
3.  **Groups:** (Dropdown)

To the far right, a search function is present, indicated by a text input field with the placeholder **"Search"**. An orange circular information icon precedes the search field.

**Table Structure (Headers):**
The data is presented in a table format with eight columns. Two columns display sort indicators (bidirectional arrows):
*   Report
*   Type
*   Groups
*   Accounts
*   Generated on (Sortable)
*   Status
*   Download (Sortable)
*   Details

**Data Row (Example Record):**
A single report record is visible:
*   **Report:** "Group and User Report Cards" (preceded by a yellow PDF file icon).
*   **Type:** "Group Report Card"
*   **Groups:** "Clickers"
*   **Accounts:** "Partner Sales Demo"
*   **Generated on:** "02/10/2025" (followed by a small repeat/resend icon).
*   **Status:** A green pill-shaped label reading **"Completed"**.
*   **Download:** A blue download icon.
*   **Details:** A right-pointing chevron icon.
images.context: See the image below for details on the information each column contains.
